info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 13 at 1:33PM MST until December 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 5 PM WEDNESDAY FOR THE NORTHEASTERN PLAINS DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS, AND LOW HUMIDITY... .A very strong and fast moving storm system will quickly pass over New Mexico Wednesday providing incredibly strong wind speeds across eastern NM. Peak surface winds of 35 to 50 mph with gusts to 70 mph are possible through the northeastern plains Wednesday afternoon. Although temperatures will sharply fall, very dry air will still cause humidity to fall to the low teens during the afternoon. These conditions will allow any fire starts to quickly grow out of control where fuels exist. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 30 to 40 mph becoming west at 40 to 50 mph in the afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
